page.title: 06Farming
page.content:
There are a lot of farms in our area. Most of the farmers keep dairy cows but some have beef cattle, sheep and pigs. Some of the land is fairly flat and is good but there is also a lot of steeply sloping poor land. All the farmers we interviewed make either silage or hay for winter fodder. Silage is now more popular than hay, mainly because it is easier to get. Some farmers also buy straw, which comes from outside our area.
Farms here are quite small compared with the rest of the country. Some of the farmers work full time on the land, often employing extra workers at harvest time. Those farms which are very small combine farming with another occupation.
